publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4941 Pauline McNeill: Doors Open Day Proves a Hit—That the Parliament congratulates the organisers of Glasgow’s Doors Open Day, now in its 20th year, which ran from Thursday 17 to Sunday 20 September 2009, with thousands of people taking the opportunity to look inside some of the city’s most historic and interesting buildings, including theatres, churches and galleries; notes that entry was completely free, and applauds new arts hub Trongate 103, which welcomed 2,250 visitors through its doors, as well as venues such as Glasgow’s Police Museum, which welcomed 1,200 people, the Glasgow Steiner School, which welcomed 400 people, and the Glasgow Art Club on Bath Street, which had around 300 visitors.

S3M-4941 Doors Open Day Proves a Hit (lodged on 25 September 2009) Jamie Hepburn*, Sandra White*, James Kelly*, Kenneth Gibson*, Mary Mulligan*, Jackie Baillie*, Jamie McGrigor*, Jackson Carlaw*, Jim Tolson*, Helen Eadie*
S3M-4941 Doors Open Day Proves a Hit (lodged on 25 September 2009) Karen Whitefield*, Trish Godman*
S3M-4941 Doors Open Day Proves a Hit (lodged on 25 September 2009) Karen Gillon*
S3M-4941 Doors Open Day Proves a Hit (lodged on 25 September 2009) Gil Paterson*
S3M-4941 Doors Open Day Proves a Hit (lodged on 25 September 2009) Ken Macintosh*
